task_summary: The robot must pick up the red object from the table surface using a sequential pick routine, reliably detecting and grasping the item according to visual and physical feedback.

task_long_description.overview: This episode showcases a robotic arm tasked to pick up a red cylindrical object from a marked tabletop. The sequence starts with object detection and localization, involves a top-approach grasp strategy, physical contact sensing, and ends when the red object is securely held. The workspace includes blue tape markers and the red object; no other movable items are present. Visual detection is supplemented by reacquisition if required, and grasp stability is confirmed.
preconditions: Red object is present and accessible on the table
Robot gripper is empty and operational
Workspace is unobstructed; markers do not block the red object
stepwise_plan: Check object visibility or scan until found
Open gripper and move above target
Verify grasp stability and object in gripper
success_criteria: Red object is securely held in the robot's gripper
No damage or displacement of table markers
Reliable detection and stable grasp confirmed
failure_and_recovery: Object not detected: scan repeatedly up to 3 times
Grasp fail: retry approach and alignment
task_long_description.termination: Tree terminates when 'ObjectInGripper' for red_object returns true after a stable grasp.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if red object is visible
Scans for red object if not visible
Detects the appearance and location of the red object
Opens the gripper to a width for picking
Moves the gripper above the red object
Computes a top-down grasp pose for the red object
Approaches and aligns gripper to the grasp pose
Lowers gripper until contact with the red object is detected
Closes the gripper with moderate force to grasp the object
Checks that the grasp is stable
Confirms that the red object is held in the gripper

failure_modes: Red object not detected due to occlusion or lighting
Scan fails to find the object within retry limit
Gripper fails to close or grasp is unstable
Contact not detected during lowering phase
recovery_strategy: Re-scan for object up to 3 times
Retry alignment or lowering if contact/grasp unstable
assumptions: Frames show only picking (no placement as instruction kind may imply)
Red object is the correct target; markers are not involved
No instruction parameters for force or tolerance, selected moderate defaults
Table location inferred from frames; no specific pose naming required

expected_success_criteria: Red object is being consistently and stably held in gripper by episode end
All steps successfully executed in order without skipping
